oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Farmland near Watauga River
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Croplands; farms; barns
Agriculture; Watauga River (N.C. and Tenn.); Barns - Tennessee - History
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Farmland and farm buildings near the Watagua River in East Tennessee. A barn and crop of corn are clearly visible in the forground with a range of mountains in the background.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: J. T. McGill
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The river valleys of East Tennessee have historically been friendly to farmers of the region. With soils containing a mixture of limestone, shale, and sandstone, early farmers were able to sustain an assortment of grains and speciality crops and support a variety of farm animals.
